I had my first kid at 27. I was very well set up in life. House, wife, job etc. I know lots of people who had their kids much younger when their lives were chaos and not at all ready for their kids and did brilliantly in the situation. For my part I split from the wife and sold the house for a massive profit. Still see my child half of all days and am doing well as a parent and personally. Me and the ex still get on really well.

If we would have had our kid earlier maybe we would have been closer through working through those hard times together. Maybe she wouldn't have been as pampered and entitled. Maybe we wouldn't have broke up. Maybe I would have had more energy to raise my kid if I hadn't been doing the lion's share of it in my thirties. Or maybe some other disaster would have befallen us and neither of us would have been mature enough to raise our kid properly or save for the house or have a break up like mature adults that put the kids first. Anything can happen.

I would say that if you're ready to have kids, if you're set up and prepared for it, don't wait another day. Every day, every moment with your kids is a gift, start as early as you can.
